Articles.Content:
Hey everyone!

Today I want to ask you, how much KSP's have you got? I mean as in how many versions on your computer memory? I have 0.8 (There was a thread to find it so I got it and saved it ) 0.13.3 0.14 0.15 and 0.16. And of course the latest 0.17.

So guys what have you got?
One. 0.17. Why would you want to keep more?
i deleted all of mine, way back to point 0.9 when i first played. hopefully previos versions become available to the public eventually. 0.10 was a good time
I've only got the updates I was here for: 0.16 & 0.17

i deleted all of mine, way back to point 0.9 when i first played. hopefully previos versions become available to the public eventually. 0.10 was a good time

That is one of the things that Squad are thinking of doing, as a kind of Gold edition release, as it is I have 0.8, 0.13.2 and .3, plus the major versions after that.

One. 0.17. Why would you want to keep more?

To see how the game has progressed and try the older versions if you want
If you are interested in how KSP has changed over the releases, you might want to look here

If you are interested in how KSP has changed over the releases, you might want to look here

I like that
Long way since i started in .13! It's growing up so fast, it's like seeing a baby grow. I remember not even having Minmus, and getting to the Mun was a pain without the patched conics!
I started in 0.13 so I have backups of every version from then to now, including a copy of 0.8 I got from the KSP tumblr page.
I have every paid version (14.4, 15.2, 0.16) thus far released. Oh and 0.17 as well, naturally.

Long way since i started in .13! It's growing up so fast, it's like seeing a baby grow. I remember not even having Minmus, and getting to the Mun was a pain without the patched conics!

I found it was easy enough without Patch conics to achieve Mun SOI capture.

But I used a process of predicting where the Mun would be, through Phase Angle's. Wouldn't dare try that approach with the new solar system in .17!

I could have swarn there was a public version .6 (A build, that didn't include struts as a part)?

I could have swarn there was a public version .6 (A build, that didn't include struts as a part)?

If you by struts mean strut connectors then they where added in v0.9.

I remember the time before the strut connector.. Everything wobbled

Ah yes, getting to the moon without patched conics was fun.

I waited until it was like 5-10 degrees from directly overhead, and burned straight to it. On my first try, I was ignorant of the phrase or meaning of 'retroburn' and slammed into it at several km/s

I used to have my old copy of 13.2 on my desktop, but never brought it over to my lappy. Oh well.
I have .13 .15 and point .17 rarely play .15
I have 0.13., 0.14.1, 0.14.4, 0.15, 0.16, and of course, 0.17

I have several of the old releases zipped, but currently only .17 "installed." I usually keep the last release installed for a few days in case something is weird. I deleted 0.16 once MechJeb stopped triggering the Space Cthulu bug.

got 0.13 0.15 0.16 0.17

0.14.2 and 0.14.1 are on my external HDD but i haven't pulled them off yet
I have 0.15,0.16 and 0.17 not counting the minor updates
I have a copy of 0.13.3 and 0.17. Might have 0.16 on my other computers.
I used to have the 0.9 a while back, now idk where they are :/
So far I have 0.13 through 0.17. I should open up 0.13 again to get a feel for how much the game has really changed.
A couple. I don't tend to keep a large number of previous versions on the computer.

So far I have 0.13 through 0.17. I should open up 0.13 again to get a feel for how much the game has really changed.

I did that the other day. I got a sense of how overbuilt my rockets were, and how much lag has been eliminated. I started zooming out to see the other planets and felt pretty stupid.

I've only got 0.17, since 64Gb of SSD storage is too valuable to keep deprecated versions on hand!

Although I have been rocketing (and crashing ) since 0.11. Never had a 35km atmosphere to enjoy from previous versions!
